intro: Tripterococcus brunonis, commonly known as the African olive, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and fragrant, resinous bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange or red fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in humid climates. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in various parts of the world.
